metadata.title: Detection of multiple respiratory viruses by real-time polymerase chain reaction in infants attending an outpatient clinic

abstract.original_text: The detection of respiratory viruses in many prospective clinical studies has relied upon detection with standard laboratory assays, such as antigen detection, viral culture, or serology. Data describing the relative importance of community-acquired respiratory viruses, such as rhinovirus, human metapneumovirus (HMPV) [1], and newly described human coronavirus (HCV) subtypes [2], which are Eur

sentences.segment_text: The detection of respiratory viruses in many prospective clinical studies has relied upon detection with standard laboratory assays ,
such as antigen detection , viral culture , or serology .
Data describing the relative importance of community-acquired respiratory viruses ,
such as rhinovirus , human metapneumovirus ( HMPV ) ( 1 ) ,
and newly described human coronavirus ( HCV ) subtypes ( 2 ) , which are Eur
